text: I’m gonna sit this out this year, or maybe do 5k but my knee is f’d
What the hell is it with all of our knees hahahahahhah
:slightly_frowning_face:
I've been considering skipping it but also really don't want to. Having a hard time....
I did a 2.5 with my brace this morning and that helped but am still a bit worried.
mine is from my gait being screwed up after not being able to properly fit in my running gear post-holidays
We could always run together Dennis and go slowly.
sorry if overshare
Oh no!!!
The holidays are brutal on our bodies lol
and i dont trust myself to not race a 5k.  so doubtful
Yes, that's fair.
im doing 5k
I'm doing the 8.

I should have done the 5.
you can switch at any time, btw
Oooooooo
i was 15k and emailed them, they dont care
I didn't know that
It's all the same price?
It's a tempting option. About to go for my fifth run of the year. Not feeling too great about 13 miles on Sunday.
I found the page about switching. Never mind :slightly_smiling_face:
Can you send the link <@U1HKQRLMR>? I may switch as well. Lunges are still making my knee mad

attachments.title: Shamrock Run :: How to Change Events/Distances
attachments.text: Here's the information you need on changing events/distances at the Shamrock Run. Please contact us for further help!
attachments.fallback: Shamrock Run :: How to Change Events/Distances

text: Basically, you have to go on Friday or Saturday to the fair with your bib to change it.

So I'm feeling pretty torn. I ran the 8k a couple years ago and didn't run at all before it. Just went and did it and was able to run the whole thing. I really haven't run since H2C except for once last week and once this week for 2 and 2.5 miles. And my knee is still healing. I'm just not sure if I should do the 8k and just walk some of it if I need to or if I should take it down a notch and do the 5k.
Any thoughts, <!channel>?
You're all much more experienced runners than I am.
I always lean towards playing it safe
That makes sense.
